<!--  %**** String Line 25 **** --><?latexml RelaxNGSchema="LaTeXML"?>
<document xmlns="http://dlmf.nist.gov/LaTeXML" class="ltx_authors_1line ltx_leqno">
  <resource src="LaTeXML.css" type="text/css"/>
  <resource src="ltx-article.css" type="text/css"/>
  <resource src="ltx-amsart.css" type="text/css"/>
  <title>Kumjian-Pask algebras <break/>of locally convex higher-rank graphs</title>
  <toctitle>Kumjian-Pask algebras of locally convex higher-rank graphs</toctitle>
  <creator role="author">
    <personname>Lisa Orloff Clark</personname>
  </creator>
  <creator before=", " role="author">
    <personname>Claire Flynn</personname>
  </creator>
  <creator before=" and " role="author">
    <personname>Astrid an Huef</personname>
    <contact role="address">Lisa Orloff Clark, Claire Flynn, Astrid an Huef: Department of Mathematics and Statistics,
University of Otago, P.O. Box 56, Dunedin 9054, New Zealand.</contact>
  </creator>
  <date name="Date:" role="creation">18 April, 2013</date>
  <abstract name="Abstract."/>
  <abstract name="Abstract.">
    <p>The Kumjian-Pask algebra of a higher-rank graph generalises the Leavitt path algebra of a directed
graph. We extend the definition of Kumjian-Pask algebra to row-finite higher-rank graphs <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="m1">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> with sources which satisfy a
local-convexity condition. After proving versions of the graded-uniqueness theorem and the Cuntz-Krieger uniqueness theorem,
we study the Kumjian-Pask algebra of rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="m2">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> Bratteli diagrams by studying certain finite subgraphs which are locally convex.
We show that the desourcification procedure of Farthing and Webster yields a row-finite higher-rank graph <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="m3">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> without sources
such that the Kumjian-Pask algebras of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="m4">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="m5">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> are Morita equivalent. We then use the Morita equivalence to study
the ideal structure of the Kumjian-Pask algebra of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="m6">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> by pulling the appropriate results across the equivalence.</p>
  </abstract>
  <keywords name="Key words and phrases">Kumjian-Pask algebra, higher-rank graph, Leavitt path algebra, Cuntz-Krieger algebra, graph algebra</keywords>
  <classification name="2000 Mathematics Subject Classification" scheme="2000 Mathematics Subject Classification">16W50</classification>
  <acknowledgements>The first author was supported by a University of Otago research grant and the second
author was supported by a grant from the Division of Sciences at the University of Otago.</acknowledgements>

    <title><tag close=". ">1</tag>Introduction</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">1</tag>Introduction</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S1.p1">
      <p>The Kumjian-Pask algebras were introduced in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> as higher-rank analogues of
the Leavitt path algebras associated to a directed graph <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S1.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Since they were introduced in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="AA1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="AMP" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>,
the Leavitt path algebras have attracted a lot of attention, see, for example, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="AA2,AA3,AB,AG,AGP,G,GR,Smith,T1,T" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.
A <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S1.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph is a category <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with a degree functor <Math mode="inline" tex="d:\Lambda\to{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="d colon Lambda to N ^ k" xml:id="S1.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> which generalise the path category of <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S1.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the
length function <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda\mapsto|\lambda|" text="lambda maps-to absolute-value@(lambda)" xml:id="S1.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p1.m6.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m6.1">λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on the paths <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda" text="lambda" xml:id="S1.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S1.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, respectively. Thus we think of the set <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S1.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of
objects as vertices and of the morphisms <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda\in\Lambda" text="lambda element-of Lambda" xml:id="S1.p1.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as paths of “shape” or degree <Math mode="inline" tex="d(\lambda)" text="d * lambda" xml:id="S1.p1.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p1.m11.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m11.1">λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and demand that paths
factor uniquely: if <Math mode="inline" tex="d(\lambda)=m+n" text="d * lambda = m + n" xml:id="S1.p1.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>

                  <XMWrap>

                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m12.1">λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="N ^ k" xml:id="S1.p1.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>

          </XMath>
        </Math>, then there exist unique <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu,\nu\in\Lambda" text="list@(mu, nu) element-of Lambda" xml:id="S1.p1.m14">

                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m14.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m14.2">ν</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="d(\mu)=m" text="d * mu = m" xml:id="S1.p1.m15">
          <XMath>

                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p2">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be a commutative ring with <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S1.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S1.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph without sources. The authors of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> construct
a graded algebra <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m5.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m5.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p2.m5.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p2.m5.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, called the Kumjian-Pask algebra, which is universal for so-called Kumjian-Pask families.
If <Math mode="inline" tex="k=1" text="k = 1" xml:id="S1.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> then <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m7.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m7.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p2.m7.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p2.m7.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is isomorphic to the Leavitt path algebra <Math mode="inline" tex="L_{R}(E)" text="L _ R * E" xml:id="S1.p2.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p2.m8.1">E</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
where <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S1.p2.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the directed graph with vertices the objects of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p2.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and edges the paths of degree 1.
<!--  %**** String Line 75 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p3">
      <p>Here we define a Kumjian-Pask algebra for row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S1.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graphs which may have sources but are “locally convex”, a condition
which restricts the types of sources that can occur. We were motivated by the study of <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebras and Kumjian-Pask
algebras of “rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S1.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> Bratteli diagrams” in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="PRRS,ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. These Bratteli diagrams are <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S1.p3.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graphs <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p3.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> without
sources,
but their Kumjian-Pask algebras can profitably be studied by looking at finite subgraphs <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{N}" text="Lambda _ N" xml:id="S1.p3.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> which have sources but are
locally convex. In <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{\mathbb{C}}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ C)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p3.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m7.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m7.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m7.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m7.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> was analysed by embedding it inside <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(\Lambda)" text="C ^ * * Lambda" xml:id="S1.p3.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m8.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and then using the
<Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p3.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-subalgebras <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(\Lambda_{N})" text="C ^ * * Lambda _ N" xml:id="S1.p3.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m10.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m10.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the subgraphs to deduce results about <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{\mathbb{C}}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ C)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p3.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m11.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m11.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m11.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m11.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. A sample theorem obtained
in this way illustrates how the dichotomy for Leavitt path algebras of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="AA3" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 4.5]</cite> does not hold for Kumjian-Pask algebras.
In particular, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 7.10]</cite> gives a class <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{C}" text="C" xml:id="S1.p3.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S1.p3.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> Bratteli diagrams such that
for each <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda\in\mathcal{C}" text="Lambda element-of C" xml:id="S1.p3.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{\mathbb{C}}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ C)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p3.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m15.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m15.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m15.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m15.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
simple but is neither purely infinite nor locally matricial. A key performance indicator for our new definition of the
Kumjian-Pask algebra was an extension of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 7.10]</cite> to arbitrary fields, and this is achieved in
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm-point"/> below. For more motivation, the K-theory of the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p3.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebras of these rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S1.p3.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> Bratteli
diagrams was computed in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="PRRS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> as a direct limit of the K-groups of suitable <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(\Lambda_{N})" text="C ^ * * Lambda _ N" xml:id="S1.p3.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m18.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m18.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and a similar
approach should work to compute the algebraic K-theory of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p3.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m19.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m19.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m19.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m19.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p4">
      <p>Now let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be a locally convex, row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S1.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph. After finding the appropriate notion of Kumjian-Pask
family of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in this setting, we have obtained a new Kumjian-Pask algebra <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p4.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m4.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m4.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p4.m4.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m4.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with a very
satisfactory theory: <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p4.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m5.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m5.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p4.m5.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m5.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is generated by a universal
Kumjian-Pask family <Math mode="inline" tex="(p,s)" text="open-interval@(p, s)" xml:id="S1.p4.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>

                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m6.1">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m6.2">s</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the properties of <Math mode="inline" tex="(p,s)" text="open-interval@(p, s)" xml:id="S1.p4.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m7.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m7.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m7.1">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m7.2">s</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> ensure that <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)={\operatorname{\mathrm{span}}}\{s_{\lambda}s_{%&#10;\mu^{*}}:\lambda,\mu\in\Lambda\}" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda) = span@(s _ lambda * s _ (mu ^ *) colon list@(lambda, mu) element-of Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p4.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m8.5"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m8.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p4.m8.5">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m8.1">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m8.4"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m8.6"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S1.p4.m8.4">span</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p4.m8.6">
                      <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m8.2"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m8.3"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m8.2">λ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m8.3">μ</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> (see §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec-family"/>),
and there are versions of both the graded-uniqueness and the Cuntz-Krieger uniqueness theorems (see §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec-uniquenessthms"/>).
Then, several applications of the graded-uniqueness theorem shows that for <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p4.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the class <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{C}" text="C" xml:id="S1.p4.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> mentioned above, <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p4.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m11.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p4.m11.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p4.m11.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p4.m11.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is neither purely infinite nor locally matricial (see §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec-Bratteli"/>).</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p5">
      <p>There is a construction by Farthing <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="F" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and Webster <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="W" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, called the desourcification of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
<!--  %**** String Line 100 **** -->which yields a row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S1.p5.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p5.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> without sources such that the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p5.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebras <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="C ^ * * tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p5.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m5.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p5.m5.1">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(\Lambda)" text="C ^ * * Lambda" xml:id="S1.p5.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m6.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p5.m6.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
are Morita equivalent. In §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec-Morita"/>, we show that <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S1.p5.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m7.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m7.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p5.m7.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p5.m7.1">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p5.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m8.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m8.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p5.m8.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p5.m8.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are Morita equivalent
as well. This result is new even when <Math mode="inline" tex="k=1" text="k = 1" xml:id="S1.p5.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S1.p5.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the path category of a row-finite directed graph.
In §§<ref labelref="LABEL:sec-simplicity"/>-<ref labelref="LABEL:sec-ideals"/> we study the ideal structure of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p5.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m11.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m11.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p5.m11.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p5.m11.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by pulling the
relevant results for <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S1.p5.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m12.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m12.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p5.m12.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p5.m12.1">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> across the Morita equivalence. Thus we obtain graph-theoretic
characterisations of basic simplicity and simplicity, and show that there is a lattice isomorphism between the
graded basic ideals of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S1.p5.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m13.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p5.m13.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p5.m13.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p5.m13.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the saturated, hereditary subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S1.p5.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:lc" xml:id="S2">
    <tags>
      <tag>2</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§2</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">2</tag>Preliminaries</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">2</tag>Preliminaries</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S2.p1">
      <p>We write <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{N}}" text="N" xml:id="S2.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for the set of non-negative integers. We view <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{N}}" text="N" xml:id="S2.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as a category with one object. Fix <Math mode="inline" tex="k\in{\mathbb{N}}\setminus\{0\}" text="k element-of N set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="S2.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p1.m3.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p1.m3.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
We often write <Math mode="inline" tex="n\in{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="n element-of N ^ k" xml:id="S2.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as <Math mode="inline" tex="(n_{1},\dots,n_{k})" text="vector@(n _ 1, dots, n _ k)" xml:id="S2.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p1.m5.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p1.m5.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p1.m5.3"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p1.m5.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p1.m5.1">…</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p1.m5.3">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and say <Math mode="inline" tex="m\leq n" text="m less= n" xml:id="S2.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="N ^ k" xml:id="S2.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{i}\leq n_{i}" text="m _ i less= n _ i" xml:id="S2.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for
all <Math mode="inline" tex="1\leq i\leq k" text="1 less= i less= k" xml:id="S2.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We use <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{i}" text="e _ i" xml:id="S2.p1.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for the usual basis elements in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="N ^ k" xml:id="S2.p1.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, so that <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{i}" text="e _ i" xml:id="S2.p1.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S2.p1.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the <Math mode="inline" tex="i" text="i" xml:id="S2.p1.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>th coordinate and <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S2.p1.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the others. We denote the join and meet in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="N ^ k" xml:id="S2.p1.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by <Math mode="inline" tex="\vee" text="or" xml:id="S2.p1.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="or" name="vee" role="ADDOP">∨</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\wedge" text="and" xml:id="S2.p1.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="and" name="wedge" role="ADDOP">∧</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> respectively.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p2">
      <p>A <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S2.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math><text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">-graph</text> <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Lambda,d)" text="open-interval@(Lambda, d)" xml:id="S2.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m2.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m2.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m2.1">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m2.2">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a countable category <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S2.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
with a functor <Math mode="inline" tex="d:\Lambda\to{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="d colon Lambda to N ^ k" xml:id="S2.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, called the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">degree map</text>, satisfying the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">factorisation property</text>:
if <Math mode="inline" tex="d(\lambda)=m+n" text="d * lambda = m + n" xml:id="S2.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m5.1">λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for some <Math mode="inline" tex="m,n\in{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="list@(m, n) element-of N ^ k" xml:id="S2.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m6.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m6.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m6.1">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m6.2">n</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, then there exist unique <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S2.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.p2.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S2.p2.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such that
<Math mode="inline" tex="d(\mu)=m,d(\nu)=n" text="formulae@(d * mu = m, d * nu = n)" xml:id="S2.p2.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m10.3"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m10.4"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p2.m10.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m10.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m10.1">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p2.m10.4">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m10.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m10.2">ν</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda=\mu\nu" text="lambda = mu * nu" xml:id="S2.p2.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In this case, we often write <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda(0,m)" text="lambda * open-interval@(0, m)" xml:id="S2.p2.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m12.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m12.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p2.m12.1">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m12.2">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S2.p2.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p3">
      <p>We denote the set of objects in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S2.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S2.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and use the factorisation property to identify the morphisms <Math mode="inline" tex="d^{-1}(0)" text="d ^ (- 1) * 0" xml:id="S2.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p3.m3.1">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of degree <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S2.p3.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S2.p3.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We write <Math mode="inline" tex="r" text="r" xml:id="S2.p3.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="s" text="s" xml:id="S2.p3.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for the domain and codomain maps from <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S2.p3.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S2.p3.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
The path category associated to a directed graph is a <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S2.p3.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph, and motivated by this we call <Math mode="inline" tex="r" text="r" xml:id="S2.p3.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="s" text="s" xml:id="S2.p3.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the range and source maps, and elements of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S2.p3.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S2.p3.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> paths and vertices, respectively.
For <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in\Lambda^{0}" text="v element-of Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S2.p3.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="m\in{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="m element-of N ^ k" xml:id="S2.p3.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, we write</p>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></td>
            </MathBranch>
          </MathFork>
        </equation>
        <equation xml:id="S2.Ex3">
          <MathFork>
            <Math tex="\displaystyle v\Lambda^{m}:=\Lambda^{m}\cap v\Lambda." text="v * Lambda ^ m assign Lambda ^ m intersection v * Lambda" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m3.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>

    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_ex" inlist="thm theorem:ex" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Example 2.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Example 2.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="italic">Example 2.1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1">
        <p>Fix <Math mode="inline" tex="m\in({\mathbb{N}}\cup\{\infty\})^{k}" text="m element-of (N union set@(infinity)) ^ k" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m1.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m1.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m1.1">∞</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and define</p>
        <equation xml:id="S2.Ex4">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\Omega_{k,m}:=\{(p,q)\in{\mathbb{N}}^{k}\times{\mathbb{N}}^{k}:p\leq q\leq m\}." text="Omega _ (list@(k, m)) assign conditional-set@(open-interval@(p, q) element-of N ^ k * N ^ k, p less= q less= m)" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.5"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.5">

                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.1">k</XMTok>

                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.2">m</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>

                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.5.1"/>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.5.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.3"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.4"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.3">p</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.4">q</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.5.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>

                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>This is a category with objects</p>

        <p>and range and source maps <Math mode="inline" tex="r(p,q)=p" text="r * open-interval@(p, q) = p" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m2">

Paths <Math mode="inline" tex="(p,q)" text="open-interval@(p, q)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="(r,s)" text="open-interval@(r, s)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m5.1">r</XMTok>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are
composable if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="q=r" text="q = r" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and then <Math mode="inline" tex="(p,q)(q,s)=(p,s)" text="open-interval@(p, q) * open-interval@(q, s) = open-interval@(p, s)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m7.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m7.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m7.1">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m7.2">q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m7.3"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>

                  </XMDual>

                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
