    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:page-cofinal LABEL:sec_cofinal" xml:id="S5.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>5.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§5.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">5.1</tag>Application to rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> Bratteli diagrams</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">5.1</tag>Application to rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> Bratteli diagrams</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p1">
        <p>Throughout this subsection,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-graph without sources which is a rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> Bratteli diagram in the sense of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="PRRS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Definition 4.1]</cite>.
This means that the blue subgraph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{{\operatorname{\mathrm{blue}}}}" text="Lambda ^ blue" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">blue</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of paths of degree <Math mode="inline" tex="(n_{1},0)" text="open-interval@(n _ 1, 0)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m5.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m5.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m5.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m5.1">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Bratteli diagram in the usual sense: the vertex set <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the disjoint union <Math mode="inline" tex="\bigsqcup_{n=0}^{\infty}V_{n}" text="((square-union _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(V _ n)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="square-union" name="bigsqcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊔</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of finite subsets <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{n}" text="V _ n" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, each blue edge goes from some <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{n+1}" text="V _ (n + 1)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{n}" text="V _ n" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The red subgraph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{{\operatorname{\mathrm{red}}}}" text="Lambda ^ red" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">red</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of paths of degree <Math mode="inline" tex="(0,n_{2})" text="open-interval@(0, n _ 2)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m12.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m12.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m12.1">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m12.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> consists of disjoint cycles whose vertices lie entirely in some <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{n}" text="V _ n" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. For each blue edge <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> there is a unique red edge <Math mode="inline" tex="f" text="f" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="s(f)=r(e)" text="s * f = r * e" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m16.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m16.1">f</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m16.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m16.2">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and hence by the factorization property there is a unique blue-red path <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}(e)h" text="F * e * h" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m17.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m17.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}(e)h=fe" text="F * e * h = f * e" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m18.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m18.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The map <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}:\Lambda^{e_{1}}\to\Lambda^{e_{1}}" text="F colon Lambda ^ (e _ 1) to Lambda ^ (e _ 1)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a bijection, and induces a permutation of each finite set <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{e_{1}}V_{n}" text="Lambda ^ (e _ 1) * V _ n" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We write <Math mode="inline" tex="o(e)" text="o * e" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m21.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m21.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for the order of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>: the smallest <Math mode="inline" tex="l&gt;0" text="l &gt; 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}^{l}(e)=e" text="F ^ l * e = e" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m24.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m24.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p2">
        <p>A <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-graph without sources is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">cofinal</text> if for every <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in\Lambda^{\infty}" text="x element-of Lambda ^ infinity" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and every <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in\Lambda^{0}" text="v element-of Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, there exists <Math mode="inline" tex="n\in{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="n element-of N ^ k" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="v\Lambda x(n)\neq\emptyset" text="v * Lambda * x * n not-equals empty-set" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m5.1">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="empty-set" name="emptyset" role="ID">∅</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
It follows from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="PRRS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 5.1]</cite> that if <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is cofinal and <Math mode="inline" tex="\{o(e)\}" text="set@(o * e)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m7.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m7.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m7.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m7.1">e</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is unbounded, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is aperiodic; and hence if <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a field, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m10.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m10.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m10.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m10.1">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is simple by <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Corollary 7.8]</cite>. So the cofinal rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> Bratteli diagrams give a rich supply of simple Kumjian-Pask algebras.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p3">
        <p>Theorem 7.10 of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> uses rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> Bratteli diagrams to show that there are simple Kumjian-Pask algebras that are neither purely infinite nor locally matricial. But the analysis in §7 of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> specialises to <Math mode="inline" tex="K={\mathbb{C}}" text="K = C" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> because the proof reduces to a “rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> Bratteli diagrams <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{N}" text="Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of depth <Math mode="inline" tex="N" text="N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>”, which is a <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-graph with sources. In the absence of a Kumjian-Pask algebra for such graphs, the embedding into <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(\Lambda_{N})" text="C ^ * * Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p3.m7.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m7.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is used. This was one of our motivations for defining a Kumjian-Pask algebra for graphs with sources in the first place, and we now show that we can extend
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 7.10]</cite> from <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{C}}" text="C" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to arbitrary fields <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (see Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm-point"/> below). Note that
we will use the letter <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in place of <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> when we are explicitly assuming the underlying ring is a field.
We start with three lemmas.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_lemma" inlist="thm theorem:lemma" labels="LABEL:lem-helper-cut'" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4">
        <tags>
          <tag>Lemma 5.4</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.4</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Lemma 5.4</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Lemma 5.4</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> Bratteli diagram.
Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{N}" text="Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be the rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> Bratteli diagram of depth <Math mode="inline" tex="N" text="N" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> consisting of all the paths in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which begin and end in <Math mode="inline" tex="\bigcup_{n=0}^{N}V_{n}" text="((union _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(V _ n)" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋃</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{N}" text="Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is locally convex and the subalgebra <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{\mathrm{span}}}\{s_{\mu}s_{\nu^{*}}:\mu,\nu\in\Lambda_{N}\}" text="span@(s _ mu * s _ (nu ^ *) colon list@(mu, nu) element-of Lambda _ N)" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9.3">span</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9.4">
                          <XMTok font="upright" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9.1"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9.1">μ</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                <XMTok name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m9.2">ν</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m10.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m10.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m10.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m10.1">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is canonically isomorphic to <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda_{N})" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda _ N)" xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m11.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m11.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m11.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.Thmthm4.p1.m11.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p4">
          <p>The graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{N}" text="Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> has sources, but satisfies (<ref labelref="LABEL:3.1"/>), and hence is locally convex <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="PRRS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, page 141]</cite>.
For <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in\Lambda_{N}^{0}" text="v element-of (Lambda _ N) ^ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda\in\Lambda_{N}" text="lambda element-of Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, set <Math mode="inline" tex="Q_{v}=p_{v}" text="Q _ v = p _ v" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="T_{\lambda}=s_{\lambda}" text="T _ lambda = s _ lambda" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="T_{\lambda^{*}}=s_{\lambda^{*}}" text="T _ (lambda ^ *) = s _ (lambda ^ *)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. We will show that <Math mode="inline" tex="(Q,T)" text="open-interval@(Q, T)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p4.m7.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p4.m7.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m7.1">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m7.2">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a Kumjian-Pask <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{N}" text="Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-family in <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p4.m9.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p4.m9.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m9.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m9.1">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Both (KP1) and (KP2) for <Math mode="inline" tex="(Q,T)" text="open-interval@(Q, T)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p4.m10.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p4.m10.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m10.1">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m10.2">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> immediately reduce to (KP1) and (KP2) for the <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-family <Math mode="inline" tex="(p,s)" text="open-interval@(p, s)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p4.m12.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p4.m12.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m12.1">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p4.m12.2">s</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p5">
          <p>For (KP3<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{\prime}" text="^prime" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUPERSCRIPT" scriptpos="3">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>), let <Math mode="inline" tex="n\in{\mathbb{N}}^{2}\setminus\{0\}" text="n element-of N ^ 2 set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p5.m2.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m2.1">0</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda,\mu\in\Lambda_{N}^{\leq n}" text="list@(lambda, mu) element-of (Lambda _ N) ^ (absent less= n)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p5.m3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p5.m3.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m3.1">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m3.2">μ</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
Since</p>
          <equation xml:id="S5.Ex7">
            <Math mode="display" tex="T_{\lambda^{*}}T_{\mu}=T_{\lambda^{*}}Q_{r(\lambda)}Q_{r(\mu)}T_{\mu}=\delta_{%&#10;r(\lambda),r(\mu)}T_{\lambda^{*}}T_{\mu}," text="T _ (lambda ^ *) * T _ mu = T _ (lambda ^ *) * Q _ (r * lambda) * Q _ (r * mu) * T _ mu = delta _ (list@(r * lambda, r * mu)) * T _ (lambda ^ *) * T _ mu" xml:id="S5.Ex7.m1">
              <XMath>

          <p>if <Math mode="inline" tex="r(\lambda)\neq r(\mu)" text="r * lambda not-equals r * mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p5.m4.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m4.1">λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p5.m4.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m4.2">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="T_{\lambda^{*}}T_{\mu}=0=\delta_{\lambda,\mu}Q_{s(\mu)}" text="T _ (lambda ^ *) * T _ mu = 0 = delta _ (list@(lambda, mu)) * Q _ (s * mu)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p5.m5.1"/>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                        <XMDual>

                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                          </XMWrap>

                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. So we may assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="r(\lambda)=r(\mu)" text="r * lambda = r * mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p5.m6.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p5.m6.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p5.m6.2">μ</XMTok>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p6">
          <p>Notice that <Math mode="inline" tex="d(\lambda)_{2}=d(\mu)_{2}=n_{2}" text="d * lambda _ 2 = d * mu _ 2 = n _ 2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p6.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p6.m1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
