                              <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex28.m1.1.2.2.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                                  <XMText rpadding="5.0pt"> and </XMText>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>A simple ring is
<text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">purely infinite</text> if every nonzero right ideal of <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S5.SS1.p14.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> contains an infinite idempotent <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="AGP" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, §1]</cite>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_prop" inlist="thm theorem:prop" labels="LABEL:prop-notpi" xml:id="S5.Thmthm7">
        <tags>
          <tag>Proposition 5.7</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.7</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition 5.7</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition 5.7</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.Thmthm7.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> Bratteli diagram, and <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> a field. If <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is cofinal and aperiodic, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m5.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m5.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m5.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Thmthm7.p1.m5.1">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is not purely infinite.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p15">
          <p>Since <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is cofinal and aperiodic, and <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a field, <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m3.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m3.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m3.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m3.1">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is simple by <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 6.1]</cite>.
Let <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{0}:=\sum_{v\in V_{0}}p_{v}" text="P _ 0 assign (sum _ (v element-of V _ 0))@(p _ v)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Since the property of being purely infinite and simple
passes to corners by <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="AA2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Proposition 10]</cite>, it suffices to prove that <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{0}\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)P_{0}" text="P _ 0 * (KP _ K)@(Lambda) * P _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m5.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m5.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m5.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m5.1">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is not purely infinite. We argue by contradiction: suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{0}\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)P_{0}" text="P _ 0 * (KP _ K)@(Lambda) * P _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m6.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m6.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m6.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m6.1">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is purely infinite.
Then <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{0}\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)P_{0}" text="P _ 0 * (KP _ K)@(Lambda) * P _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m7.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m7.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m7.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m7.1">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> contains an infinite idempotent <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then there exist nonzero idempotents <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{1}" text="p _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{2}" text="p _ 2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and elements <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="y" text="y" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{0}\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)P_{0}" text="P _ 0 * (KP _ K)@(Lambda) * P _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p15.m13.2"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m13.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

          <p>Choose <Math mode="inline" tex="N\in{\mathbb{N}}" text="N element-of N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> large enough to ensure that all five elements can be written as linear combinations of elements <Math mode="inline" tex="s_{\lambda}s_{\mu^{*}}" text="s _ lambda * s _ (mu ^ *)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for which <Math mode="inline" tex="s(\lambda)" text="s * lambda" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="s(\mu)" text="s * mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m17">
              <XMath>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are in <Math mode="inline" tex="\bigcup_{n=0}^{N}V_{n}" text="((union _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(V _ n)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p15.m18">
              <XMath>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.

        </para>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p16">
          <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{N}" text="Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be the rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> Bratteli diagram of depth <Math mode="inline" tex="N" text="N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="(q,t)" text="open-interval@(q, t)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m4.1">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m4.2">t</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be the generating Kumjian-Pask <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{N}" text="Lambda _ N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-family in <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda_{N})" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda _ N)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m6.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m6.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m6.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m6.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and set <Math mode="inline" tex="Q_{0}=\sum_{v\in V_{0}}q_{v}" text="Q _ 0 = (sum _ (v element-of V _ 0))@(q _ v)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda_{N})" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda _ N)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m8.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m8.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m8.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m8.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is canonically isomorphic to the subalgebra <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{\mathrm{span}}}\{s_{\mu}s_{\nu^{*}}:\mu,\nu\in\Lambda_{N}\}" text="span@(s _ mu * s _ (nu ^ *) colon list@(mu, nu) element-of Lambda _ N)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>

                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m9.4">
                        <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>

                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>

                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m9.1"/>

                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>

                              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m9.2">ν</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m10.1">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> by Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lem-helper-cut'"/>, we may assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{1}" text="p _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m12">
              <XMath>

            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{2}" text="p _ 2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m13">
              <XMath>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="y" text="y" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are all in <Math mode="inline" tex="Q_{0}\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda_{N})Q_{0}" text="Q _ 0 * (KP _ K)@(Lambda _ N) * Q _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m16.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p16.m16.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m16.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p16.m16.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p17">
          <p>Next we will decompose <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda_{N})" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda _ N)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p17.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p17.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p17.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p17.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p17.m1.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> into a direct sum. Using (KP4<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{\prime}" text="^prime" xml:id="S5.SS1.p17.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUPERSCRIPT" scriptpos="3">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>),</p>
          <equation xml:id="S5.Ex29">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda_{N})={\operatorname{\mathrm{span}}}\{t_{\lambda}%&#10;t_{\mu^{*}}:s(\lambda)=s(\mu)\in V_{N}\}." text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda _ N) = span@(t _ lambda * t _ (mu ^ *) colon s * lambda = s * mu element-of V _ N)" xml:id="S5.Ex29.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.Ex29.m1.4"/>
                  <XMWrap>

                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex29.m1.4.1"/>

                      </XMDual>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex29.m1.3"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex29.m1.4.3"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S5.Ex29.m1.3">span</XMTok>
                          <XMWrap>

                            <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex29.m1.4.3">
                              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                                </XMApp>

                                    <XMWrap>

                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>

                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>

                          </XMWrap>
