                    <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p19">
          <p>Evaluation at <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in K" text="z element-of K" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a homomorphism, and so <Math mode="inline" tex="f(z)g(z)=q(z)" text="f * z * g * z = q * z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m2.1">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m2.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m2.2">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m2.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m2.3">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="g(z)f(z)=q_{1}(z)" text="g * z * f * z = q _ 1 * z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m3.1">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m3.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m3.2">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m3.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m3.3">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="g(z)" text="g * z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m4.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is an isomorphism of <Math mode="inline" tex="q(z)K^{X}" text="q * z * K ^ X" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m5.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> onto <Math mode="inline" tex="q_{1}(z)K^{X}" text="q _ 1 * z * K ^ X" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m6.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. So the matrices <Math mode="inline" tex="q(z)" text="q * z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m7.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m7.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="q_{1}(z)" text="q _ 1 * z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m8.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m8.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> have the same rank. On the other hand, since <Math mode="inline" tex="q_{1}(z)" text="q _ 1 * z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m9.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="q_{2}(z)" text="q _ 2 * z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m10.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m10.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are orthogonal, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{\mathrm{rank}}}(q_{1}(z)+q_{2}(z))={\operatorname{\mathrm{rank}%&#10;}}q_{1}(z)+{\operatorname{\mathrm{rank}}}q_{2}(z)" text="rank@(q _ 1 * z + q _ 2 * z) = rank@(q _ 1) * z + rank@(q _ 2) * z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m11.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m11.6"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m11.3">rank</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m11.6">
                          <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m11.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m11.1">z</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m11.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m11.2">z</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">rank</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m11.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m11.4">z</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">rank</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m11.5"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m11.5">z</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Now <Math mode="inline" tex="q=q_{1}+q_{2}" text="q = q _ 1 + q _ 2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> implies that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{\mathrm{rank}}}q_{2}(z)=0" text="rank@(q _ 2) * z = 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">rank</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m13.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m13.1">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for all <Math mode="inline" tex="z" text="z" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. This contradicts that <Math mode="inline" tex="q_{2}" text="q _ 2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is nonzero. Thus there is no infinite idempotent in <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{0}\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)P_{0}" text="P _ 0 * (KP _ K)@(Lambda) * P _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m16.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m16.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m16.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m16.1">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, as claimed. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{0}\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)P_{0}" text="P _ 0 * (KP _ K)@(Lambda) * P _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m17">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m17.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m17.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m17.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m17.1">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is not purely infinite, and neither is <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m18">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m18.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p19.m18.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m18.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p19.m18.1">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p20">
        <p>Recall that a matricial algebra is a finite direct product of full matrix algebras and
we say an algebra is locally matricial algebra if it is direct limit of matricial algebras.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm-point" xml:id="S5.Thmthm8">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 5.8</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.8</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 5.8</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 5.8</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.Thmthm8.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S5.Thmthm8.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a rank-<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.Thmthm8.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> Bratteli diagram which is cofinal and aperiodic, and <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S5.Thmthm8.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> a field. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.Thmthm8.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm8.p1.m4.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm8.p1.m4.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.Thmthm8.p1.m4.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Thmthm8.p1.m4.1">Λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is simple, but is neither purely infinite nor locally matricial.
<!--  %**** String Line 950 **** --></text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p21">
          <p>By <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 6.1]</cite>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{K}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ K)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p21.m1.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p21.m1.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m1.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m1.1">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is simple, and by Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop-notpi"/> it is not purely infinite. To see that it is not locally matricial, consider the element <Math mode="inline" tex="s_{\mu}" text="s _ mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> associated to a single red cycle <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="v:=r(\mu)=s(\mu)" text="v assign r * mu = s * mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p21.m4.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m4.1">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p21.m4.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m4.2">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> receives just one red path of length <Math mode="inline" tex="|\mu|" text="absolute-value@(mu)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p21.m5.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m5.1">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, namely <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, the Kumjian-Pask relation (KP4<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{\prime}" text="^prime" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUPERSCRIPT" scriptpos="3">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>) at <Math mode="inline" tex="v" text="v" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="n=|\mu|e_{2}" text="n = absolute-value@(mu) * e _ 2" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p21.m9.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m9.1">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> (which only involves red paths) says that <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{v}=s_{\mu}s_{\mu}^{*}" text="p _ v = s _ mu * (s _ mu) ^ *" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. But, as seen in the proof of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lem-badapple"/>, the subalgebra generated by <Math mode="inline" tex="s_{\mu}" text="s _ mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is isomorphic to the Leavitt path algebra of the directed graph consisting of a single vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="w" text="w" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and a single loop <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> at <Math mode="inline" tex="w" text="w" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, which is in turn isomorphic to <Math mode="inline" tex="K[x,x^{-1}]" text="K * closed-interval@(x, x ^ (- 1))" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p21.m15.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p21.m15.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m15.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m15.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="s_{\mu}" text="s _ mu" xml:id="S5.SS1.p21.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> generates an infinite-dimensional algebra, and does not lie in a finite-dimensional subalgebra.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S6">
    <tags>
      <tag>6</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">6</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§6</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">6</tag>Desourcification</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">6</tag>Desourcification</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S6.p1">
      <p>Throughout this section, <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S6.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a locally convex, row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S6.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph.
In Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:m_context"/> we show that the Kumjian-Pask algebra of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S6.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
Morita equivalent to a Kumjian-Pask algebra of a certain <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S6.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
without sources. The graph <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">desourcification of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S6.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math></text>. The construction of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and the Morita equivalence of the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S6.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebras <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(\Lambda)" text="C ^ * * Lambda" xml:id="S6.p1.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m10.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m10.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="C ^ * * tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p1.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m11.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p1.m11.1">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> goes back to Farthing <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="F" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. Farthing’s construction was refined by Robertson and Sims in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="RS2009" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, and then generalised to finitely aligned <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S6.p1.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graphs by Webster in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="W" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. The difference in the approaches is that Farthing’s construction adds paths and vertices to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S6.p1.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to obtain a graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\overline{\Lambda}" text="overline@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p1.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and the Robertson-Sims-Webster construction abstractly builds a <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\Lambda}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p1.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> which is then shown to contain a copy of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S6.p1.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. When <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S6.p1.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is locally convex,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\overline{\Lambda}" text="overline@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p1.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\Lambda}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p1.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are isomorphic.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p2">
      <p>We use <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\Lambda}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and start by giving the details about <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\Lambda}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that we need. Set</p>
      <equation xml:id="S6.Ex1">
        <Math mode="display" tex="V_{\Lambda}:=\{(x;m):x\in\Lambda^{\leq\infty},m\in{\mathbb{N}}^{k}\}\text{\ %&#10;and\ }P_{\Lambda}:=\{(x;(m,n)):x\in\Lambda^{\leq\infty},m\leq n\in{\mathbb{N}}%&#10;^{k}\};" text="V _ Lambda assign conditional-set@(list@(x, m), formulae@(x element-of Lambda ^ (absent less= infinity), m element-of N ^ k)) * [ and ] * P _ Lambda assign conditional-set@(list@(x, open-interval@(m, n)), formulae@(x element-of Lambda ^ (absent less= infinity), m less= n element-of N ^ k))" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6">
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.1">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.2">m</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.2">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.2.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.2.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.2.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.2.2">
                              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMText> and </XMText>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.3">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.5"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.3.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.5">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                          <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.3.1">
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.3"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.4"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.4">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.4.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6.4.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.4.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                                <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.6.4.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>the vertices and paths of <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\Lambda}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S6.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are quotients of these sets, respectively.
For this, define relations <Math mode="inline" tex="\approx" text="approximately-equals" xml:id="S6.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{\Lambda}" text="V _ Lambda" xml:id="S6.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\sim" text="similar-to" xml:id="S6.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="similar-to" name="sim" role="RELOP">∼</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on
<Math mode="inline" tex="P_{\Lambda}" text="P _ Lambda" xml:id="S6.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as in Definitions 4.2 and 4.3 of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="W" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. First,
define <Math mode="inline" tex="(x;m)\approx(y;p)" text="list@(x, m) approximately-equals list@(y, p)" xml:id="S6.p2.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m8.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m8.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m8.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m8.2">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m8.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m8.4"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m8.3">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m8.4">p</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{\Lambda}" text="V _ Lambda" xml:id="S6.p2.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if and only if</p>
      <enumerate xml:id="S6.I1">
        <item xml:id="S6.I1.ix12">
          <tags>
            <tag>(V1)</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item (V1)</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S6.I1.ix12.p1">
            <p><Math mode="inline" tex="x(m\wedge d(x))=y(p\wedge d(y))" text="x * (m and d * x) = y * (p and d * y)" xml:id="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1.3">
                            <XMTok meaning="and" name="wedge" role="ADDOP">∧</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1.4">
                            <XMTok meaning="and" name="wedge" role="ADDOP">∧</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1.2"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I1.ix12.p1.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item xml:id="S6.I1.ix13">
          <tags>
            <tag>(V2)</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item (V2)</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S6.I1.ix13.p1">
            <p><Math mode="inline" tex="m-m\wedge d(x)=p-p\wedge d(y)" text="(m - m) and d * x = (p - p) and d * y" xml:id="S6.I1.ix13.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="and" name="wedge" role="ADDOP">∧</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.I1.ix13.p1.m1.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I1.ix13.p1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="and" name="wedge" role="ADDOP">∧</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.I1.ix13.p1.m1.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I1.ix13.p1.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </enumerate>
      <p>It is straightforward to check that <Math mode="inline" tex="\approx" text="approximately-equals" xml:id="S6.p2.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an equivalence relation, and we denote the class of <Math mode="inline" tex="(x;n)" text="list@(x, n)" xml:id="S6.p2.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m11.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m11.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m11.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m11.2">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by <Math mode="inline" tex="[x;n]" text="list@(x, n)" xml:id="S6.p2.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m12.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m12.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m12.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m12.2">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
We view <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{\Lambda}/\!\!\approx" xml:id="S6.p2.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP" rpadding="-3.3pt">/</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as a set of vertices that includes
<!--  %**** String Line 975 **** -->a copy of the vertices in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S6.p2.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Indeed, if <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in\Lambda^{0}" text="v element-of Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S6.p2.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="v=x(0)" text="v = x * 0" xml:id="S6.p2.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m16.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p2.m16.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for some <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in\Lambda^{\leq\infty}" text="x element-of Lambda ^ (absent less= infinity)" xml:id="S6.p2.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>; we can think of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S6.p2.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with the equivalence classes of elements <Math mode="inline" tex="(x;0)" text="list@(x, 0)" xml:id="S6.p2.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m19.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m19.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m19.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p2.m19.2">0</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and item (V1) above ensures
this identification is well defined.
The set <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{\Lambda}/\!\!\approx" xml:id="S6.p2.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP" rpadding="-3.3pt">/</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> also includes elements that are not identified
with vertices in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S6.p2.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
In particular, for each <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in\Lambda^{\leq\infty}" text="x element-of Lambda ^ (absent less= infinity)" xml:id="S6.p2.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
with <Math mode="inline" tex="d(x)&lt;\infty" text="d * x less infinity" xml:id="S6.p2.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>

                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m23.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m23.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, there is one element in <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{\Lambda}/\!\!\approx" xml:id="S6.p2.m24">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>

            <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP" rpadding="-3.3pt">/</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for each <Math mode="inline" tex="m&gt;d(x)" text="m &gt; d * x" xml:id="S6.p2.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>

                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m25.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m25.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p3">
      <p>Second, define <Math mode="inline" tex="(x;(m,n))\sim(y;(p,q))" text="list@(x, open-interval@(m, n)) similar-to list@(y, open-interval@(p, q))" xml:id="S6.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="similar-to" name="sim" role="RELOP">∼</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p3.m1.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p3.m1.7"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p3.m1.3">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S6.p3.m1.7">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p3.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p3.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p3.m1.1">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p3.m1.2">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p3.m1.6"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p3.m1.8"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p3.m1.6">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S6.p3.m1.8">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p3.m1.4"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p3.m1.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p3.m1.4">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p3.m1.5">q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{\Lambda}" text="P _ Lambda" xml:id="S6.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
