            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:Claire_Prop_11''"/> gives:</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_cor" inlist="thm theorem:cor" labels="LABEL:cor-Morita" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5">
      <tags>
        <tag>Corollary 7.5</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">7.5</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Corollary 7.5</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Corollary 7.5</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Lambda,d)" text="open-interval@(Lambda, d)" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m1.1">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m1.2">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a locally convex, row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-graph and let <Math mode="inline" tex="(\tilde{\Lambda},d)" text="open-interval@(tilde@(Lambda), d)" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m3.1">
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m3.2">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be the
desourcification of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then there is a surjective Morita context between <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m5.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m5.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m5.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m5.1">
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m6.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m6.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m6.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmthm5.p1.m6.1">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:m_context"/>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S7.p17">
        <p>Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lem-helpMorita"/> gives (<ref labelref="LABEL:item-aa"/>). For (<ref labelref="LABEL:item-bb"/>) we start by observing that the map <Math mode="inline" tex="f:M\times N\to\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="f colon M * N to (KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S7.p17.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m1.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m1.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m1.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m1.1">
                          <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is bilinear, so that by the universal property of the tensor product there is a unique linear map <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi_{f}:M\otimes N\to\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="psi _ f colon M tensor-product N to (KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S7.p17.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m2.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m2.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m2.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m2.1">
                          <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi_{f}(m\otimes n)=mn" text="psi _ f * (m tensor-product n) = m * n" xml:id="S7.p17.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The range of <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi_{f}" text="psi _ f" xml:id="S7.p17.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="MN" text="M * N" xml:id="S7.p17.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, which is <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S7.p17.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m6.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m6.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m6.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m6.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lem-helpMorita"/>. To see that <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi_{f}" text="psi _ f" xml:id="S7.p17.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> factors through the quotient map <Math mode="inline" tex="q:M\otimes N\to M\otimes_{B(\tilde{\Lambda})}N" text="q colon M tensor-product N to M tensor-product _ (B * tilde@(Lambda)) N" xml:id="S7.p17.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp meaning="tensor-product" role="MULOP">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m8.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m8.1">
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we observe that for <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in{B(\tilde{\Lambda})}" text="x element-of B * tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S7.p17.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m9.1">
                        <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> we have
<Math mode="inline" tex="\psi_{f}(m\cdot x\otimes n-m\otimes x\cdot n)=(mx)n-m(xn)=0." text="psi _ f * ((m cdot x) tensor-product n - (m tensor-product x) cdot n) = m * x * n - m * x * n = 0" xml:id="S7.p17.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m10.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m10.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m10.1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m10.1.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m10.1.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m10.1.2">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m10.1.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m10.1.3">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
Now there is a unique linear map <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi:M\otimes_{B(\tilde{\Lambda})}N\to\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\tilde{\Lambda})" text="psi colon M tensor-product _ (B * tilde@(Lambda)) N to (KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S7.p17.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp meaning="tensor-product" role="MULOP">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m11.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m11.1">
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m11.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m11.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m11.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m11.2">
                          <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi\circ q=\psi_{f}" text="psi compose q = psi _ f" xml:id="S7.p17.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi" text="psi" xml:id="S7.p17.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is surjective and <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi(m\otimes_{B(\tilde{\Lambda})}n)=mn" text="psi * (m tensor-product _ (B * tilde@(Lambda)) n) = m * n" xml:id="S7.p17.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m14.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m14.2">
                        <XMApp meaning="tensor-product" role="MULOP">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.p17.m14.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S7.p17.m14.1">
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. That <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi" text="psi" xml:id="S7.p17.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a bimodule homomorphism follows because the actions are by multiplication.
The analogous assertions about <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="S7.p17.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> follows in the same way. This gives (<ref labelref="LABEL:item-bb"/>).
<!--  %**** String Line 1325 **** --></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.p18">
        <p>For (<ref labelref="LABEL:item-cc"/>) it remains to verify (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq-ops"/>), but this is immediate since everything is defined in terms of the associative multiplication in <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S7.p18.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p18.m1.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p18.m1.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p18.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.p18.m1.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S7.p19">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S7.p19.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be a row-finite directed graph, and <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S7.p19.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the directed graph obtained from <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S7.p19.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by adding “infinite heads” to sources, as in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BPRS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, page 310]</cite>. Then the path categories <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{E}" text="Lambda _ E" xml:id="S7.p19.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{F}" text="Lambda _ F" xml:id="S7.p19.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S7.p19.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graphs; <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S7.p19.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> may have sources but is trivially locally convex.
By <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="W" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Proposition 4.11]</cite>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}_{E}" text="(tilde@(Lambda)) _ E" xml:id="S7.p19.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is isomorphic to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{F}" text="Lambda _ F" xml:id="S7.p19.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
The Leavitt path algebra <Math mode="inline" tex="L_{R}(F)" text="L _ R * F" xml:id="S7.p19.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p19.m10.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p19.m10.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the universal <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S7.p19.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebra generated by a Leavitt <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S7.p19.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-family <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="T" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Definition 3.1]</cite>, and any Leavitt <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S7.p19.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-family gives a Kumjian-Pask <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{F}" text="Lambda _ F" xml:id="S7.p19.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-family and vice versa. Thus by Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm-KP"/>(<ref labelref="LABEL:item-a"/>), <Math mode="inline" tex="L_{R}(F)" text="L _ R * F" xml:id="S7.p19.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p19.m15.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p19.m15.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda_{F})" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda _ F)" xml:id="S7.p19.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p19.m16.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p19.m16.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.p19.m16.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p19.m16.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are isomorphic. Similarly, <Math mode="inline" tex="L_{R}(E)" text="L _ R * E" xml:id="S7.p19.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p19.m17.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p19.m17.1">E</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda_{E})" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda _ E)" xml:id="S7.p19.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p19.m18.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p19.m18.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.p19.m18.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p19.m18.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are isomorphic. Thus we obtain the following corollary which is the analogue of the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S7.p19.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebraic result <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BPRS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Lemma 1.2(c)]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_cor" inlist="thm theorem:cor" xml:id="S7.Thmthm6">
      <tags>
        <tag>Corollary 7.6</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">7.6</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Corollary 7.6</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Corollary 7.6</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S7.Thmthm6.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a row-finite directed graph, and <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> the directed graph obtained from <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> by adding “infinite heads” to sources. Then there is a surjective Morita context between the Leavitt path algebras <Math mode="inline" tex="L_{R}(F)" text="L _ R * F" xml:id="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m4.1">F</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="L_{R}(E)" text="L _ R * E" xml:id="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmthm6.p1.m5.1">E</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S7.p20">
      <p>There is a more general procedure, called “desingularisation”, which takes a directed graph <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S7.p20.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
that is not necessarily row-finite and constructs a row-finite directed graph <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S7.p20.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> without sources such that <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(F)" text="C ^ * * F" xml:id="S7.p20.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p20.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p20.m3.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(E)" text="C ^ * * E" xml:id="S7.p20.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p20.m4.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p20.m4.1">E</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are Morita equivalent <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DT" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 2.11]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec-simplicity" xml:id="S8">
    <tags>
      <tag>8</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">8</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§8</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">8</tag>Simplicity and basic simplicity</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">8</tag>Simplicity and basic simplicity</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S8.p1">
      <p>Throughout this section, <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S8.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a locally convex, row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S8.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph,
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S8.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is its desourcification and <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S8.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a commutative ring with <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S8.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
We show
that the Morita context between <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S8.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m6.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m6.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S8.p1.m6.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p1.m6.1">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S8.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m7.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m7.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S8.p1.m7.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p1.m7.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:cor-Morita"/>
preserves <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">basic</text> ideals (see below for the definition). We then transfer simplicity
results about <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S8.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m8.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m8.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S8.p1.m8.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p1.m8.1">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> proved in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> to <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S8.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m9.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m9.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp xml:id="S8.p1.m9.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p1.m9.1">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S8.p2">
      <p>A subset <Math mode="inline" tex="H\subseteq\Lambda^{0}" text="H subset-of-or-equals Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S8.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of-or-equals" name="subseteq" role="RELOP">⊆</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">hereditary</text> if
<!--  %**** String Line 1350 **** -->for every <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in H" text="v element-of H" xml:id="S8.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda\in\Lambda" text="lambda element-of Lambda" xml:id="S8.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="r(\lambda)=v" text="r * lambda = v" xml:id="S8.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p2.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p2.m4.1">λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
we have <Math mode="inline" tex="s(\lambda)\in H" text="s * lambda element-of H" xml:id="S8.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p2.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p2.m5.1">λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We say <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S8.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">saturated</text> if for <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in\Lambda^{0}" text="v element-of Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S8.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,</p>
      <equation xml:id="S8.Ex1">
        <Math mode="display" tex="s(v\Lambda^{\leq e_{i}})\subseteq H\text{ for some }i\in\{1,...,k\}\implies v%&#10;\in H." text="s * v * Lambda ^ (absent less= e _ i) subset-of-or-equals H * [ for some ] * i element-of set@(1, ldots, k) implies v element-of H" xml:id="S8.Ex1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S8.Ex1.m1.4"/>

                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>

                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Ex1.m1.4.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex1.m1.4.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                              <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="subset-of-or-equals" name="subseteq" role="RELOP">⊆</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMText> for some </XMText>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Ex1.m1.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S8.Ex1.m1.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S8.Ex1.m1.2">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Ex1.m1.3">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok meaning="implies" role="ARROW">⟹</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>See <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="RSY03" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, page 113]</cite>.
In this section, we will apply these definitions to <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S8.p2.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> which has no
sources; then the definition of ‘saturated’ above is equivalent to: or <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in\Lambda^{0}" text="v element-of Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S8.p2.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,</p>
      <equation xml:id="S8.Ex2">
        <Math mode="display" tex="s(v{\tilde{\Lambda}}^{n})\subseteq H\text{ for some }n\in{\mathbb{N}}^{k}%&#10;\implies v\in H." text="s * v * (tilde@(Lambda)) ^ n subset-of-or-equals H * [ for some ] * n element-of N ^ k implies v element-of H" xml:id="S8.Ex2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S8.Ex2.m1.1"/>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>

                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_lemma" inlist="thm theorem:lemma" labels="LABEL:lem:sat_pi" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Lemma 8.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">8.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Lemma 8.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Lemma 8.1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a locally convex, row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-graph and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
its desourcification. Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a saturated and hereditary subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}^{0}" text="(tilde@(Lambda)) ^ 0" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then
<Math mode="inline" tex="v\in H" text="v element-of H" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(v)\in H" text="pi * v element-of H" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m7.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmthm1.p1.m7.1">v</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S8.p3">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in{\tilde{\Lambda}}^{0}" text="v element-of (tilde@(Lambda)) ^ 0" xml:id="S8.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Write
<Math mode="inline" tex="v=[z;m]" text="v = list@(z, m)" xml:id="S8.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m2.1">z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m2.2">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> where <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in\Lambda^{\leq\infty}" text="z element-of Lambda ^ (absent less= infinity)" xml:id="S8.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="m\in{\mathbb{N}}^{k}" text="m element-of N ^ k" xml:id="S8.p3.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(v)=[z;d(z)\wedge m]" text="pi * v = list@(z, d * z and m)" xml:id="S8.p3.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m5.1">v</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m5.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m5.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m5.3">z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.p3.m5.4">
                      <XMTok meaning="and" name="wedge" role="ADDOP">∧</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m5.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m5.2">z</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Notice that <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda:=[z;(d(z),m\wedge d(z))]\in{\tilde{\Lambda}}" text="lambda assign list@(z, open-interval@(d * z, m and d * z)) element-of tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S8.p3.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m6.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m6.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m6.3">z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                    <XMDual xml:id="S8.p3.m6.4">
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m6.4.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m6.4.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.p3.m6.4.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m6.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m6.1">z</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.p3.m6.4.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="and" name="wedge" role="ADDOP">∧</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m6.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m6.2">z</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has source <Math mode="inline" tex="v" text="v" xml:id="S8.p3.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and range <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(v)" text="pi * v" xml:id="S8.p3.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m8.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p3.m8.1">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
and</p>
        <equation xml:id="S8.Ex3">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\pi(v){\tilde{\Lambda}}^{m-m\wedge d(z)}=\{\lambda\}" text="pi * v * (tilde@(Lambda)) ^ ((m - m) and d * z) = set@(lambda)" xml:id="S8.Ex3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>

                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.Ex3.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>

                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="and" name="wedge" role="ADDOP">∧</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S8.Ex3.m1.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

        <p>Now suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in H" text="v element-of H" xml:id="S8.p4.m1">
