                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S9.Ex8.m1.7.3.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S9.Ex8.m1.7.3.1">
                                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Using Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lem:sat_pi"/>, we have <Math mode="inline" tex="H\cap\iota(\Lambda^{0})=\pi(H)" text="H intersection iota * Lambda ^ 0 = pi * H" xml:id="S9.p11.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S9.p11.m11.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S9.p11.m11.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S9.p11.m11.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p11.m11.1">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and by Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:inversepi"/>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(H)" text="pi * H" xml:id="S9.p11.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p11.m12.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p11.m12.1">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a hereditary subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="\iota(\Lambda^{0})" text="iota * Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S9.p11.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p11.m13.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S9.p11.m13.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="L(I_{H})=J_{\pi(H)}" text="L * I _ H = J _ (pi * H)" xml:id="S9.p11.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S9.p11.m14.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S9.p11.m14.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S9.p11.m14.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p11.m14.1">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:ideal-gen"/>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm-ideals" xml:id="S9.Thmthm4">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 9.4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">9.4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 9.4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 9.4</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S9.Thmthm4.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda" text="Lambda" xml:id="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a locally convex, row-finite <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-graph. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="G\mapsto J_{G}" text="G maps-to J _ G" xml:id="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a lattice isomorphism from the hereditary, saturated subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> to the basic graded ideals of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m5.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m5.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m5.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.Thmthm4.p1.m5.1">Λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S9.p12">
        <p>Since <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\Lambda}" text="tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S9.p12.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is row-finite without sources, <Math mode="inline" tex="H\mapsto I_{H}" text="H maps-to I _ H" xml:id="S9.p12.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a lattice isomorphism from the hereditary, saturated subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}^{0}" text="(tilde@(Lambda)) ^ 0" xml:id="S9.p12.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> onto the basic, graded ideals of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S9.p12.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m4.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m4.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m4.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m4.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ACaHR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 5.1]</cite>. By Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:m_context"/>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}({\tilde{\Lambda}})" text="(KP _ R)@(tilde@(Lambda))" xml:id="S9.p12.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m5.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m5.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m5.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m5.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is Morita equivalent to its subalgebra <Math mode="inline" tex="B(\tilde{\Lambda})" text="B * tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S9.p12.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m6.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and the induced lattice isomorphism sends <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{H}" text="I _ H" xml:id="S9.p12.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to <Math mode="inline" tex="J_{\pi(H)}" text="J _ (pi * H)" xml:id="S9.p12.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m8.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p12.m8.1">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:MOrita-graded"/>(<ref labelref="LABEL:MOrita-graded-b"/>). By Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:basicideals"/> and Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:MOrita-graded"/>(<ref labelref="LABEL:MOrita-graded-a"/>), respectively, the Morita equivalence preserves basic, graded ideals. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{H}\mapsto J_{\pi(H)}" text="I _ H maps-to J _ (pi * H)" xml:id="S9.p12.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m9.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p12.m9.1">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> maps onto the basic, graded ideals of <Math mode="inline" tex="B(\tilde{\Lambda})" text="B * tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S9.p12.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m10.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m10.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
The canonical isomorphism of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S9.p12.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m11.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m11.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m11.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p12.m11.1">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> onto <Math mode="inline" tex="B(\tilde{\Lambda})" text="B * tilde@(Lambda)" xml:id="S9.p12.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m12.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m12.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:Claire_Prop_11''"/> is graded, and hence the ideal <Math mode="inline" tex="J_{\iota^{-1}(\pi(H))}" text="J _ (iota ^ (- 1) * pi * H)" xml:id="S9.p12.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m13.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m13.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m13.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p12.m13.1">H</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S9.p12.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m14.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m14.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m14.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p12.m14.1">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> corresponding to <Math mode="inline" tex="J_{\pi(H)}" text="J _ (pi * H)" xml:id="S9.p12.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m15.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p12.m15.1">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is basic and graded, and all basic, graded ideals of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{KP}_{R}(\Lambda)" text="(KP _ R)@(Lambda)" xml:id="S9.p12.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m16.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m16.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S9.p12.m16.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">KP</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p12.m16.1">Λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> arise this way.
Composing with the lattice isomorphism <Math mode="inline" tex="G\mapsto\pi^{-1}(G)" text="G maps-to pi ^ (- 1) * G" xml:id="S9.p12.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S9.p12.m17.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.p12.m17.1">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> from the hereditary, saturated subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda^{0}" text="Lambda ^ 0" xml:id="S9.p12.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to those of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\tilde{\Lambda}}^{0}" text="(tilde@(Lambda)) ^ 0" xml:id="S9.p12.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:inversepi"/> gives the lattice isomorphism</p>
        <equation xml:id="S9.Ex9">
          <Math mode="display" tex="G\mapsto\pi^{-1}(G)\mapsto I_{\pi^{-1}(G)}\mapsto J_{\iota(G)}\mapsto J_{G}.\qed" text="G maps-to pi ^ (- 1) * G maps-to I _ (pi ^ (- 1) * G) maps-to J _ (iota * G) maps-to J _ G" xml:id="S9.Ex9.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S9.Ex9.m1.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S9.Ex9.m1.4">
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S9.Ex9.m1.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.Ex9.m1.3">G</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S9.Ex9.m1.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.Ex9.m1.1">G</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S9.Ex9.m1.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S9.Ex9.m1.2">G</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="PUNCT">∎</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
      </para>
    </proof>
  </section>
